newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Confidential Philippine flight heads for S.Korea.
newsitem.headline: Confidential Philippine flight heads for S.Korea.

text.p: A chartered plane left the Philippines on a confidential mission to South Korea on Sunday morning but officials declined to say whether the most senior official to flee North Korea was on board.
"Everything about the flight is confidential," a Philippine Airlines official said.

Hwang Jang-yop, North Korea's top ideologue, defected in Beijing on February 12 and has been in the Philippines since March 18 but his whereabouts have been kept a tight secret. He had been expected to fly to Seoul on Sunday.
The Boeing 737 left Manila's military airport at 7 a.m. local time (2300 GMT Saturday).
A senior foreign ministry official said Hwang was scheduled to leave on Sunday but would not confirm that he was on the flight, saying Hwang's safety was of paramount importance.
"Anything can happen during the three hour flight," he said.
